info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rainfall 12 miles east of Chester, or 5 miles south of Richburg, moving east at 5 mph.
Locations to be impacted include... Great Falls, Fort Lawn, Richburg, and Fishing Creek Reservoir.
In addition to intense lightning, very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction:
Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices. Do not take a shower or bath. Try to unplug unnecessary appliances before the storm approaches.

parameter.value: A THUNDERSTORM WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT EASTERN CHESTER COUNTY UNTIL 730 PM EDT
